results.title: New potential for an old kid on the block: Impact of premorbid metformin use on lactate kinetics, kidney injury and mortality in sepsis and septic shock, an observational study
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ use was also associated with reduced mortality in @<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@septic shock@@@.

citations.NLM: Van Moorter N, Tackaert T, De Decker K, Van Vlem B, De Neve N. New potential for an old kid on the block: Impact of premorbid metformin use on lactate kinetics, kidney injury and mortality in sepsis and septic shock, an observational study Endocrinol Diabetes Metab. 2023 Jan;6(1):e382. PMID: 36444165

results.title: AMPK reduces macrophage endotoxin tolerance through inhibition of TGF-beta1 production and its signaling pathway.
results.text_hl: Therefore, the present study was performed to investigate the mechanism by which the AMPK activator, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, inhibits the development of @<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@endotoxin@@@ tolerance.

citations.NLM: Yin M, Kim J, Choi JI, Bom JS, Bae HB, Jeong S. AMPK reduces macrophage endotoxin tolerance through inhibition of TGF-beta1 production and its signaling pathway. Int Immunopharmacol. 2023 May;118():110146. PMID: 37037116
citations.BibTeX: @article{37037116, title={AMPK reduces macrophage endotoxin tolerance through inhibition of TGF-beta1 production and its signaling pathway.}, author={Yin M and Kim J and Choi JI and Bom JS and Bae HB and Jeong S}, journal={Int Immunopharmacol}, volume={118}, pages={110146}}

results.title: Donohue syndrome with a homozygous INSR exon 14 deletion: a case report.
results.text_hl: Despite treatment with @CHEMICAL_Octreotide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015282 @@@octreotide@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_maltodextrin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C008315 @@@maltodextrin@@@, the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@'s condition worsened, leading to @<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@septic shock@@@, @DISEASE_Disseminated_Intravascular_Coagulation @DISEASE_MESH:D004211 @@@disseminated intravascular coagulation@@@, and @DISEASE_Multiple_Organ_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D009102 @@@multiple organ failure@@@.

citations.NLM: Almazán Monroy JD, Valle Martinez AJ, Milla Salguero SE, Perdomo Domínguez ES. Donohue syndrome with a homozygous INSR exon 14 deletion: a case report. Oxf Med Case Reports. 2025 Sep;2025(9):omaf183. PMID: 41025026
citations.BibTeX: @article{41025026, title={Donohue syndrome with a homozygous INSR exon 14 deletion: a case report.}, author={Almazán Monroy JD and Valle Martinez AJ and Milla Salguero SE and Perdomo Domínguez ES}, journal={Oxf Med Case Reports}, volume={2025}, number={9}, pages={omaf183}}

results.title: Does the Same Hyperlactatemia Cut-Off in the Context of Acute Diseases Hold the Same Meaning in Diabetes Mellitus?
results.text_hl: In the subgroup with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@DM@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Lactic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019344 @@@lactate@@@ of >4 mmol/L (N = 60), the most frequently reported potential contributors included taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ simultaneously with factors likely to enhance its accumulation (n = 37), @DISEASE_Sepsis @DISEASE_MESH:D018805 @@@sepsis@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@septic shock@@@ (n = 24), @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ (n = 7), and presence of @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@neoplasia@@@ (n = 5).

citations.NLM: Vieira IH, Petrova M, Moura JP. Does the Same Hyperlactatemia Cut-Off in the Context of Acute Diseases Hold the Same Meaning in Diabetes Mellitus? Cureus. 2022 May;14(5):e25163. PMID: 35747014
citations.BibTeX: @article{35747014, title={Does the Same Hyperlactatemia Cut-Off in the Context of Acute Diseases Hold the Same Meaning in Diabetes Mellitus?}, author={Vieira IH and Petrova M and Moura JP}, journal={Cureus}, volume={14}, number={5}, pages={e25163}}

results.title: Lactic acidosis and severe septic shock in metformin users: a cohort study
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@Lactic acidosis@@@ and severe @<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@septic shock@@@ in @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ users: a cohort study

results.title: Impact of Metformin Use on Lactate Kinetics in Patients with Severe Sepsis and Septic Shock.
results.text_hl: Impact of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Use on @CHEMICAL_Lactic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019344 @@@Lactate@@@ Kinetics in @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ with Severe @DISEASE_Sepsis @DISEASE_MESH:D018805 @@@Sepsis@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@Septic Shock@@@.

results.title: Metformin suppresses intrahepatic coagulation activation in mice with lipopolysaccharide/D-galactosamine-induced fulminant hepatitis.
results.text_hl: Previous studies have demonstrated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ attenuates @<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@endotoxic hepatitis@@@, however the mechanisms remain unclear.

citations.NLM: Gong X, Duan R, Ao JE, Ai Q, Ge P, Lin L, Zhang L. Metformin suppresses intrahepatic coagulation activation in mice with lipopolysaccharide/D-galactosamine-induced fulminant hepatitis. Mol Med Rep. 2015 Oct;12(4):6384-90. PMID: 26260849

results.title: Anti-inflammatory effects of four potential anti-endotoxaemic drugs assessed in vitro using equine whole blood assays.
results.text_hl: In this study, four compounds with potential anti-@<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@endotoxic@@@ effects, namely @CHEMICAL_Rolipram @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020889 @@@rolipram@@@, @CHEMICAL_Azithromycin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017963 @@@azithromycin@@@, @CHEMICAL_ethyl_pyruvate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C046522 @@@ethyl pyruvate@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, were investigated in vitro using @SPECIES_9796 @@@equine@@@ whole blood stimulated with bacterial @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@lipopolysaccharide@@@.

citations.NLM: Bauquier JR, Tudor E, Bailey SR. Anti-inflammatory effects of four potential anti-endotoxaemic drugs assessed in vitro using equine whole blood assays. J Vet Pharmacol Ther. 2015 Jun;38(3):290-6. PMID: 25407884
citations.BibTeX: @article{25407884, title={Anti-inflammatory effects of four potential anti-endotoxaemic drugs assessed in vitro using equine whole blood assays.}, author={Bauquier JR and Tudor E and Bailey SR}, journal={J Vet Pharmacol Ther}, volume={38}, number={3}, pages={290-6}}

results.title: Metabolic emergencies in diabetes.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@Lactic acidosis@@@ is extremely rare; may be compounded with comorbidities like tissue @DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@septic shock@@@, @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@--@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ usage inadvertently may precipitate the condition.

citations.NLM: Mukherjee AK, Chowdhury MB. Metabolic emergencies in diabetes. J Indian Med Assoc. 2006 May;104(5):244-6, 248. PMID: 17058569
citations.BibTeX: @article{17058569, title={Metabolic emergencies in diabetes.}, author={Mukherjee AK and Chowdhury MB}, journal={J Indian Med Assoc}, volume={104}, number={5}, pages={244-6, 248}}
